title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Stephen Breyer, the oldest Supreme Court Justice, plans to retire. Who appointed him?

A. Bill Clinton

B. Jimmy Carter

C. Barack Obama

D. Woodrow Wilson

---

2. A new subvariant of Omicron has been found in many countries. What's it called?

A. JD.1

B. BA.2

C. BS.3

D. DO.4

---

3. Catalonia's parliament pardoned hundreds who were convicted and executed -- as what?

A. Loyalists during the Spanish Civil War

B. Dissidents during the rule of Francisco Franco

C. Jews refusing to convert during the Inquisition

D. Witches between the 15th and 18th centuries

---

4. Military forces staged a coup and detained the president -- in which African country?

A. Benin

B. Burkina Faso

C. Burundi

D. Botswana

---

5. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said that she'll seek reelection. Which California city is in her home district?

A. San Rafael

B. San Francisco

C. San Mateo

D. Santa Monica

---

6. Zara Rutherford, at 19, became the youngest woman ever to fly solo around the world. Where did her journey start (and finish)?

A. Belgium

B. Denmark

C. Scotland

D. New Zealand

---

7. The A' Mhoine peninsula on Scotland's far north coast is in economic decline, but a plan to revive it is controversial. What does it entail?

A. A spaceport

B. A casino

C. A conference center

D. A haggis museum

---

8. A portrait called "The Man of Sorrows" sold for $54 million. Who's it by?

A. Leonardo da Vinci

B. Botticelli

C. Van Gogh

D. Damian Hirst

---

9. Elon Musk tweeted that he would "eat a happy meal on TV" if McDonald's did something. What?

A. Made the meal vegetarian

B. Included a Matchbox-sized Tesla

C. Bought 1,000 Teslas for its corporate fleet

D. Accepted dogecoin as payment

---

ANSWERS

1. A

2. B

3. D

4. B

5. B

6. A

7. A

8. B

9. D
